data.event: In 1820, the state opened a road from the Piscataquis River, which helped increase settlement.

event.title: 1820, John Parker Boyd, owner of the eastern half of the town, erected

data.event: In 1820, John Parker Boyd, owner of the eastern half of the town, erected a combination sawmill and shingle mill on the Piscataquis River.
In 1824 the town incorporated as Kilmarnock, the name chosen by Boyd.
The town surrendered its charter in 1940, and was organized as a plantation in 1942.

event.title: was organized as a plantation in 1942

data.event: The town surrendered its charter in 1940, and was organized as a plantation in 1942.
In 1967 Medford was again organized as a town.
